meanings.definition: To make someone feel excited or lightheaded.
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster ride really giddies me.
meanings.sent2: The surprise party giddies her every time.
meanings.sent3: His jokes always giddies the audience.
meanings.sent4: The thought of winning the game giddies my heart.
meanings.sent5: The puppy's playful antics giddies everyone around.

meanings.definition: A feeling of excitement or lightheadedness.
meanings.sent1: She felt the giddies after hearing the good news.
meanings.sent2: The children ran around with giddies in their eyes.
meanings.sent3: The giddies of the holiday season filled the air.
meanings.sent4: The giddies of success bubbled inside her.
meanings.sent5: The giddies of anticipation fluttered in his stomach.
